text: Go to the entrance of the Great Mine and find Seele

title: Mission Description
content: Just asBronya's being surrounded by the enemies,Seele, the backbone ofWildfirearrives just in time to save her but immediately turns to confront her after.In the end, Seele finally reveals her reason for being there:Oleg, leader of Wildfire is asking for an audience with the noble girl from the surface.Naturally, you can't pass up on this opportunity to get in touch with Wildfire. Follow Seele's instructions and head to theGreat Mine.

speaker: Seele
line: Hey, you came. That was fast.

text: What is Wildfire doing in the mine?
What trouble has Wildfire gotten into?

speaker: Seele
line: Didn't I tell you? *sigh* Long story short —

speaker: Seele
line: The underground used to have many mines. However, in recent years, some sort of corrosion called the " Fragmentum " started to spread. It's ruined a lot of mines.

speaker: Seele
line: The one we're heading into is relatively unaffected. A bunch of vagrants made it their home after their old turf was consumed by the Fragmentum. Actually, most of them are pretty honest folks...

speaker: Seele
line: But with such a large group, it's inevitable that troublemakers will find their way in. They've been stealing from the miners and picking fights. And that's not the worst of it.

speaker: Seele
line: Things are much more serious this time... For two days now, huge clashes have been breaking out between the miners and the vagrants. It isn't pretty.

speaker: Seele
line: Mines are our lifelines in the Underworld . We have to keep providing Geomarrow to the Overworld in exchange for supplies.

speaker: Seele
line: In order to quell the situation, Chief Oleg brought Wildfire into the mine and left me in charge of security for the towns. But the situation in the mine is critical — I have to back him up.

text: I don't think I understood, can you go over it again?

children.speaker: Seele
children.line: The underground used to have many mines. However, in recent years, some sort of corrosion called the "Fragmentum" started to spread. It's ruined a lot of mines.

children.speaker: Seele
children.line: The one we're heading into is relatively unaffected. A bunch of vagrants made it their home after their old turf was consumed by the Fragmentum. Actually, most of them are pretty honest folks...

children.speaker: Seele
children.line: But with such a large group, it's inevitable that troublemakers will find their way in. They've been stealing from the miners and picking fights. And that's not the worst of it.

children.speaker: Seele
children.line: Things are much more serious this time... For two days now, huge clashes have been breaking out between the miners and the vagrants. It isn't pretty.

children.speaker: Seele
children.line: Mines are our lifelines in the Underworld. We have to keep providing Geomarrow to the Overworld in exchange for supplies.

children.speaker: Seele
children.line: In order to quell the situation, Chief Oleg brought Wildfire into the mine and left me in charge of security for the towns. But the situation in the mine is critical — I have to back him up.

speaker: Seele
line: Oh, as for you... the Chief will decide your fate when we see him.

speaker: Bronya
line: Good, I've been wanting to come face to face with the leader of the Underworld.

speaker: Seele
line: Hmph, you're about to come face to face with reality.

title: Step Description
content: Just as Bronya's being surrounded by the enemies, Seele, the backbone of Wildfire arrives just in time to save her but immediately turns to confront her after.In the end, Seele finally reveals her reason for being there: Oleg, leader of Wildfire is asking for an audience with the noble girl from the surface.Naturally, you can't pass up on this opportunity to get in touch with Wildfire. All you have to do is to find Seele in the mines... But where is she?

speaker: March 7th
line: Huh? Isn't that the doctor lady?

speaker: Seele
line: What's Natasha doing here...? Things must be worse than I thought.

text: (If the player attempts to head deeper into the mine)

speaker: Seele
line: Hey, where are you going!? Don't think you can just run off — come back here and finish talking things through with Natasha.

title: Step Description
content: After arriving at the mines, you realize that things have been turned upside-down here: The miners of this mine have gotten into a violent confrontation with the vagrants.The miners that succeeded in fleeing the scene were petrified and the ones that didn't might be in dire straits. The miners' families are all crowded around the mine entrance...You notice that Chief Oleg probably isn't here. It seems like you'll have to assist Wildfire in settling the unrest before being able to meet him.

speaker: Seele
line: Nat! I didn't think you'd be here. Where's Oleg?

speaker: Natasha
line: Hey Seele, and... Sampo 's guests. So, it looks like you've already met.

speaker: Natasha
line: I haven't seen Oleg. The miners said they saw him take a group further in.

children.speaker: Natasha
children.line: Miners and their family members. They want an explanation from the instigators.

children.speaker: Natasha
children.line: This area up ahead is a vagrant dwelling, but they've sealed off the entrance. I guess they're afraid that angry miners might try to take revenge.

children.speaker: Natasha
children.line: *sigh* I heard that many were injured in the clashes, so I hurried over here to see if I could help.

children.speaker: Natasha
children.line: I heard that the miners had been having violent clashes with local thugs, with significant numbers of wounded. I hurried over to see if I could help.

children.speaker: Natasha
children.line: You see these people? They're all miners and their family members. They want an explanation from the instigators.

children.speaker: Natasha
children.line: This area up ahead is a vagrant dwelling, but they've sealed off the entrance. I guess they're afraid that angry miners might try to take revenge.

children.speaker: Natasha
children.line: Oh? You look fine to me. Sorry, I need to prioritize the wounded. There have been violent clashes between the miners and local thugs in the last few days — many people are injured.

children.speaker: Natasha
children.line: You see these people? They're all miners and their family members. They want an explanation from the instigators.

children.speaker: Natasha
children.line: This area up ahead is a vagrant dwelling, but they've sealed off the entrance. I guess they're afraid that angry miners might try to take revenge.

speaker: Seele
line: How could the situation here become such a mess?

speaker: Natasha
line: I heard that First Mining Team found a Geomarrow vein with incredible deposits... The initial estimate put it at the largest discovery in the last thirty years.

speaker: Seele
line: Are you serious? That's big news. How come I never heard about it?

speaker: Natasha
line: Well, they weren't in a hurry to make it known. Most of the mines have been contaminated by the Fragmentum — many people are out of work. They were afraid of being overwhelmed if they let the word out.

speaker: Natasha
line: But the vagrants here have keen eyes — they couldn't keep it hidden from them. Some local gangs wanted to profit from the situation, so they blackmailed the mining team for hush money... and that was the final straw.

text: That's the price of guarding a secret.

children.speaker: Natasha
children.line: *sigh* ...I can understand your thinking. It's just that the underground is in difficult straits...

text: The vein should belong to those who discovered it.

children.speaker: Natasha
children.line: As it happens, that's exactly the law we have down here. But the vagrants have their own custom: See it, share it.

speaker: Natasha
line: And that's how the clash started. Now both sides are dealing with heavy losses.

speaker: Natasha
line: So, are you guys here to help resolve the conflict?

speaker: Seele
line: They're here because they need a favor from Chief Oleg. I'm escorting them.

speaker: Seele
line: And seeing as you need that helping hand, it wouldn't be too much to ask you to lend one here first, right?

speaker: March 7th
line: Of course we wanna help... we care about other people too y'know.

text: We came here willing to help out.

children.speaker: Seele
children.line: Oh... that's quite nice of you.

text: Sounds like a fair trade off.

children.speaker: Seele
children.line: Hmph, of course it is. Nobody gives without expecting something in return.

children.speaker: Seele
children.line: Suit yourself. I'm not forcing you.

speaker: Natasha
line: Haha, I believe we're dealing with kind-hearted people here, Seele.

speaker: Natasha
line: As you've all seen, the situation down here is... strained. If you can, we really would appreciate you helping the people.

text: (ObtainNotice Under Bridge,Musketeer's Wild Wheat Felt Hat×1(2✦),  andMusketeer's Coarse Leather Gloves×1(2✦))
Provides the wearer with bonus stats. Gains bonus buffs if the wearer has a complete set equipped.

html_content:
(Interactive tutorial)
Open the Character menu to view your Relics.
Enter the Relic screen
Enter the Relic equipping menu
Select Relic
Relics can offer stat bonuses to characters.
Equip Relic
Switch to the Hands tab.
Select a Relic for the hands
Collect Relic sets to activate powerful set effects
Equip Relic
(TapTapon mobile/PressPresson controller/ClickClickon keyboard) here to view this character's Relic Recommendation

text: You can view the recommended Set , Main Stat , and Subsidiary Stats for the current character. The Set and Main Stat data are based on statistics from recently active players. You can view the recommended Set , Main Stat , and Subsidiary Stats for the current character. The Set and Main Stat data are based on statistics from recently active players. When the Relic's Main Stat or Subsidiary Stats is the recommended stat for the character currently being viewed, they would be highlighted in the Stats interface. When the Relic's Main Stat or Subsidiary Stats is the recommended stat for the character currently being viewed, they would be highlighted in the Stats interface.

Messages The Astral Express Family (Trailblazer) Found some strange items... (Trailblazer) Found some strange items... Dan Heng Relics. March 7th Relics Himeko Relics Welt These are Relics. Thanks. (Trailblazer) Thanks. So what's a relic!? (Trailblazer) So what's a relic!? Welt A construct made from a data stream. Many believe they're linked to Stellarons and the Fragmentum phenomenon. What we refer to as relics are objects corroded by the Fragmentum whose data is saved and then reconstructed. Thanks. (Trailblazer) Thanks. So what's a relic!? (Trailblazer) So what's a relic!? Welt ...You could consult Herta . She's an expert in relic research.

speaker: Bullheaded Vagrant
line: Don't come any closer! The road's blocked — stay where you are!

speaker: Anxious Miner
line: ...Whoa, easy! Why are you hiding in there? Don't you know what happened in the mine?

speaker: Bullheaded Vagrant
line: What's that got to do with us? Do you think we're the same as those thugs?

speaker: Anxious Miner
line: Is anyone with you injured? We have a doctor. She can care for your wounded!

speaker: Bullheaded Vagrant
line: Yeah right, and you can guarantee that no one there with you is out for blood? I don't believe it. Stay where you are!

speaker: Anxious Miner
line: *sigh* These guys...

speaker: Complaining Miner
line: I told Antonia from the beginning: We never should have let those vagrants mine with us. I wouldn't be in this mess if it weren't for those thugs.

speaker: Upright Miner
line: Enough already. Nobody has it easy — this is a time to help each other out.

speaker: Upright Miner
line: I remember one of your uncles had to flee Rivet Town , which makes him a vagrant too, right? Would you drive him away?

speaker: Complaining Miner
line: ...He's family. The other vagrants aren't my problem.

speaker: Worried Wife
line: Have any of you seen my husband? He's a good-looking guy — tall and thin...

speaker: Wildfire Member Caring for the Injured
line: You again? Quit joking around! No need to add to the confusion.

speaker: Worried Wife
line: *sigh* You think I'm joking? I saw you taking down the names of the miners — that's why I came over.

speaker: Wildfire Member Caring for the Injured
line: Oh... You can put the name down here.

speaker: Concerned Miner
line: Peak ... he's done for. He was asleep in there.

speaker: Exhausted Miner
line: Easy, Dr. Natasha told you to rest. What if your wound opens up again? Besides, Elaine will get him out, she's a reliable girl.

speaker: Concerned Miner
line: Elaine was in there too!? Quick, we have to—

speaker: Exhausted Miner
line: Calm down and stop worrying. Wildfire's already gone in.

text: Go deep into the mines and help the miners along the way

title: Step Description
content: On the way deeper into the mines, you can hear the constant screams in the distance. It is obvious that things have gotten pretty serious, you must help the fleeing miners along the way.However, for some reason, you seem to be able to hear the sound of someone snoring...Could it be that you're having hallucinations from the fatigue of travel?

speaker: Seele
line: The giant ore vein — the one they discovered... That must be where the clashes are centered?

speaker: Seele
line: Come on, let's get to higher ground and take a look.

speaker: March 7th
line: That person up ahead... is he asleep?

speaker: Seele
line: Let's head up and take a look, he might need help.

text: (If the player attempts to head deeper into the mine)

speaker: March 7th
line: Hey! There are still wounded here that need our help!

speaker: March 7th
line: Falling asleep in a place like this... impressive!

speaker: March 7th
line: Hey, wakey-wakey! You'll get mushrooms growing on your head~

speaker: Peak
line: Hm...? Wha...? Mushroom bread...? I can't see it on the menu... Miss Seele?

speaker: Seele
line: Have you got a death wish or something? How can you sleep here? Get back to safety and take shelter!

speaker: Peak
line: Take shelter... *gasp* I remember now! These guys came out of nowhere and got into a fight with the mining team...

speaker: Peak
line: At the time I was exhausted — I'd hardly run a few feet when one of them caught me. If it weren't for Wildfire, they'd have stolen the clothes off my back!

text: And then? Where did Wildfire go?

children.speaker: Peak
children.line: Further in, I guess. Those thugs took control of the vein ages ago — and they're fully armed. We poor, defenseless, good folks were no match for them.

children.speaker: Peak
children.line: It's only thanks to Wildfire that the Great Mine hasn't fallen into their hands completely.

children.speaker: Peak
children.line: You don't know these guys — no moral compass — they'd rob you blind in a flash! It's only thanks to Wildfire that the Great Mine hasn't fallen under their control completely.

children.speaker: Peak
children.line: Uh... speaking of which... where is Wildfire? Did they head further in? Is there a fight happening?

speaker: Seele
line: ...It seems like Chief Oleg must be up ahead. Hurry up and get back to safety — look for Nat. And try not to get into another scrap along the way.

speaker: Peak
line: Okay! Thank you for, um... getting me on my feet! If I get back soon enough, I'll have time for a nap...

title: Step Description
content: On the way deeper into the mines, you can hear the constant screams in the distance. It is obvious that things have gotten pretty serious, you must help the fleeing miners along the way.You seem to hear a painful moan nearby... Search for it in the vicinity.

speaker: Seele
line: I recognize that woman — that's Elaine from First Mining Team! Quick, let's get up there and see if she's wounded.

speaker: Seele
line: Elaine! Are you okay? Are you hurt?

speaker: Elaine
line: Seele! Thank goodness. I—I'm fine, just a couple of sprains.

speaker: Elaine
line: You've got good timing — those vagrants were asking me about the robots, but I don't know anything...

speaker: Elaine
line: Oh! Don't you know? The inner section of the Great Mine has been seized by a band of robots! Neither the mining team nor the vagrants can get anywhere near.

speaker: March 7th
line: New challengers enter! About time, human-only conflicts are so boring.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: Does anyone know where the robots come from?

speaker: Elaine
line: At first, we thought that a collective fault had occurred in the excavation machines, but then we found out that those machines didn't even belong to the mining team.

speaker: Elaine
line: They came out of nowhere and pushed the vagrants and us back. Then they blocked off the only tunnels into the inner section.

speaker: Elaine
line: Hehe, there's no way anyone in the mining team is behind this... Operating a single unit is tiring enough, but a whole group? Hehe, Impossible.

speaker: Seele
line: Then there's only one possibility... Boss Svarog .

speaker: March 7th
line: Svarog? That name sounds familiar...

speaker: Dan Heng
line: You remember the robots we defeated in the boxing gym?

speaker: March 7th
line: Oh! Boss Svarog's robots! What's his deal?

speaker: Seele
line: Let's just say he's not to be trifled with. Let's go and find some other people. Elaine, can you make it back to safety?

speaker: Elaine
line: No problem. Seele, and the rest of you — be careful...

speaker: Bronya
line: Robots aligned against humans? I've never heard of such a thing. Machines should obey humans unconditionally...

speaker: Seele
line: That's not the only thing you won't have heard of down here, princess.

title: Step Description
content: On the way deeper into the mines, you can hear the constant screams in the distance. It is obvious that things have gotten pretty serious, you must help the fleeing miners along the way.You run into a group of marauding vagrants taking advantage of the chaos... It's time to teach them a lesson!

speaker: Dense Vagrant
line: Is this elevator b—broken? Why isn't it r—responding?

speaker: Restless Vagrant
line: Why are you worried about this piece of junk? Do you really wanna go down there and be a live target for the robots?

speaker: Dense Vagrant
line: But, i—if we evacuate, then haven't we lost out?

speaker: Restless Vagrant
line: You idiot — we'll just steal off the miners! Look, I saw with my own eyes — they managed to bag some Geomarrow. This is a perfect opportunity.

speaker: Dense Vagrant
line: Oh, g—good idea!

speaker: Seele
line: Shameless. Still after the miners, are you? Time to teach you a lesson.

speaker: Seele
line: Hmph, fleeing at the first sign of danger... that's all they're good for.

speaker: March 7th
line: Huh? What's this... Did those guys leave it behind...?

speaker: March 7th
line: Wh—Whoa!

speaker: March 7th
line: What the heck!?
Beep, beep, beep... Searching for potential user...
Beep, beep, beep... Voiceprint detected. Looking up corresponding identity information... Oh my, it's an alien.

speaker: March 7th
line: Hey, it talks! And it knows that we aren't from this planet?

speaker: Dan Heng
line: It doesn't seem to be technology from here. Look — it even has an Interastral Peace Corporation logo on it.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: Perhaps it's an antiquity left behind by some past interstellar traveler.
Beep, beep, beep... Your mom's an antiquity!
Beep, beep, beep... Whatever, whatever. So you aliens know about the Interastral Peace Corporation? That's great.

speaker: Findie
line: Beep, beep, beep... Self introduction: I am Richard, the Home-Use Object Finder. Model information: Version 0.63, Professional model, Annual Deluxe package. Nickname: "Findie."

speaker: March 7th
line: A Home-Use Object Finder? Who knew the IPC made these kinds of products...

speaker: Findie
line: Beep, beep, beep... My brainwave scanner module is damaged. Please send me to an Interastral Peace Appliances retail store near you for free repair within the warranty period of 232 years 84 days.

speaker: Findie
line: Beep, beep, beep... Alien, please take me to an Interastral Peace Appliances retail store to conduct repairs—

speaker: March 7th
line: What!? This fella's already broken... What should we do, take it with us?

text: Let's take it. Maybe it could be of some use.

children.speaker: Findie
children.line: Beep, beep, beep... Yes, yes, yes. When you need to find something you can't see, just call upon Findie. That's me.

text: My inventory is already maxed out...

children.speaker: March 7th
children.line: Ugh, you need to log out once in a while.

children.speaker: Dan Heng
children.line: Let's take it with us. It doesn't take up much room. And if it really is broken, there are trashcans everywhere.

children.speaker: Findie
children.line: Beep, beep, beep... Not a trashcan! Yes, yes, yes. When you need to find something you can't see, just call upon Findie. That's me.

title: Step Description
content: On the way deeper into the mines, you can hear the constant screams in the distance. It is obvious that things have gotten pretty serious, you must help the fleeing miners along the way.You hear people arguing from deeper inside the mines. Maybe the local miners have run into trouble... Be careful and guarantee the safety of the miners!

text: (While approaching the space anchor near the marked area)

speaker: March 7th
line: Hey, what's that commotion? It sounds like there's a big argument happening...

speaker: March 7th
line: Let's get closer and take a look.

speaker: Antonia
line: ...Cowards and bullies. I don't remember you guys acting this tough around Svarog's minions. Did your parents never teach you what a backbone was?

speaker: Vagrant
line: Pff! We ain't stupid! Why would we risk our lives against the robots? And get off the high road — you can't just find a huge chunk of Geomarrow and hog it all to yourselves!

speaker: Antonia
line: This mine is our territory — the mining team is laboring here day in and day out. You guys don't even pretend like you're here to lend a hand!

speaker: Antonia
line: You're lazy. All you want is to profit off of our sweat and tears. And you don't even try hiding it! ...Disgraceful.

speaker: Vagrant
line: Where does disgrace come into it when we can't even fill our stomachs, huh!? I know your game — you're just waiting for us to starve to death, so there's more food for your mining team.

speaker: Antonia
line: ...It's a waste of time trying to reason with you. While you've been kicking up this fuss, the whole vein's been seized by robots. Now we're all in the same boat.

speaker: Vagrant
line: Hehe, right, right... we can't rely on the vein anymore... But don't forget which side brought loaded guns to the party.

speaker: Antonia
line: Whoa, easy, wh—what are you trying to pull off? I—I'm warning you, Wildfire are in the area...

speaker: Vagrant
line: Haha, empty threat! Wildfire are stuck dealing with Svarog's minions — how are they gonna help you now? Unless you're planning on taking a bullet, hand over the supplies and equipment!

speaker: Bronya
line: They're getting ready to attack! Those miners are unarmed.

speaker: Seele
line: You shameless scoundrels...

children.speaker: Seele
children.line: You stay calm if you want. I'm taking action! I know those people!

children.speaker: Seele
children.line: No need to play the hero, I'm going with you!

speaker: Bronya
line: I'm going too. We can't let these thugs get away with whatever they like!

children.speaker: Thug
children.line: Aha, and who do we have here? Do you know whose territory this is!?

children.speaker: Seele
children.line: Shut it, this isn't your territory. I'm in a hurry — I'll take you all in one go!

speaker: Antonia
line: Seele! Thank goodness you came. We were nearly...

speaker: Seele
line: Nothing but a few knuckleheads. I'm just glad you're okay. Antonia, have you seen Chief Oleg?

speaker: Antonia
line: Oleg? He took a group into the inner section. Said it was to clear off the invading robots.

speaker: Antonia
line: They've been gone for a while now. Hmph, if Wildfire was around, those thugs wouldn't have dared.

speaker: Seele
line: Seems like the core of this problem is Svarog's robots...

children.speaker: Seele
children.line: Your run-of-the-mill robots don't have a will of their own. Their aim is merely Svarog's aim.

text: We need to talk about this "boss..."

speaker: Seele
line: The boss... He appeared suddenly after the Guards were redeployed, and became a major player in the Underworld.

speaker: Seele
line: Svarog claims to be a guardian of humanity — all the ownerless robots obey his commands. They've occupied the furnace core hub, and they're not letting anyone get close.

speaker: Seele
line: Nobody knows why Svarog did any of this... He usually doesn't leave the Furnace Core and interfere unless some kind of disorder breaks out in the Underworld.

speaker: Bronya
line: ...A "guardian of humanity" that can... command robots? I've never heard of anything like...

speaker: Seele
line: Hmph, looks like your mighty Architects weren't as all-knowing as you thought.

speaker: March 7th
line: Can you two say anything without quarreling? This isn't the time! It sounds like there's danger waiting for us in the inner section, can we still get through?

text: I want to meet Svarog and his minions.

children.speaker: Seele
children.line: Right, there's unfinished business here — the chief is still down there. It's only a bunch of scrap metal. What are we afraid of?

text: We saved the miners, let's go back.

children.speaker: Seele
children.line: Easy for you to say. This isn't over — the chief and the others are still down there. It's only a bunch of scrap metal. What are we afraid of?

children.speaker: Seele
children.line: Yeah, you still need to talk with the chief. It's only a bunch of scrap metal. What are we afraid of?

speaker: March 7th
line: Ohh~ Is Seele starting to appreciate our strength? Hmm?

speaker: Seele
line: I'll be honest, you guys are hardworking. If everyone from Wildfire were as impressive as you on the battlefield, we wouldn't be so hard-pressed by Svarog.

speaker: Seele
line: Antonia, can you take the mining team back through the entrance to meet up with Natasha?

speaker: Antonia
line: Sure thing, but be careful! There are a lot of robots up ahead!

title: Step Description
content: The crisis in the mines is no more, and most of the Wildfire members have left the spot, escorting miners to safety along with them.However, Seele has not yet brought her captive, Bronya, to the chief, and you haven't had the chance to meet this important figure, a meeting with whom is the biggest motive behind this journey.Continue deeper into the mine!

speaker: Antonia
line: What kind of days are we living through...

text: What else do you know about Svarog?

children.speaker: Antonia
children.line: Svarog? I don't know much. The underground is in turmoil, everyone's focused on their own issues. Who has time to get involved in someone else's affairs?

children.speaker: Antonia
children.line: I heard the vagrants say Svarog was protecting their base near the Furnace Core. Tsk, and there I was thinking he was one of the good guys.

text: Did you bring those vagrants into the mine?

children.speaker: Antonia
children.line: Huh? What are you trying to say — that it's my fault?

children.speaker: Antonia
children.line: Forget it, I'm just tired, that's all.

children.speaker: Antonia
children.line: Even if those vagrants have no home to return to, they still have their dignity. They won't accept charity forever.

children.speaker: Antonia
children.line: They needed honest work to get them through this hardship. So, I let them join the mining team. Can anyone really say I did wrong?

children.text: You did right, but maybe that's how the problem started.

children.speaker: Antonia
children.line: The problem started with them leaving home and being dependent on charity... If you want something to blame, blame life in the Underworld.

children.text: Maybe you could have handled it better.

children.speaker: Antonia
children.line: *sigh* When it boils down to it, they only chose to form a clique because the other miners never truly accepted them... I should've seen it.

text: You seem to be familiar with Wildfire.

children.speaker: Antonia
children.line: They're a reliable group. Trust me, if we didn't have them, this area would be packed with monsters already. Just like Rivet Town.

text: That's all I have to ask.

children.speaker: Antonia
children.line: I'm about to take the mining team over to Dr. Natasha. Take care of yourselves.

speaker: Bronya
line: Is this the right way? It looks like there's a roadblock up ahead.

speaker: Seele
line: ...I'll be the judge of that. Come on, let's take a closer look.

speaker: March 7th
line: It's completely blocked by the mine cart... What do we do? Can we blow it up?

speaker: Seele
line: Easy! It belongs to the mining team. We can't just destroy it. We should try and fix it.

speaker: March 7th
line: Easier said than done... Do you know how?

speaker: Seele
line: Yeah, of course, every Underworlder worth their salt knows how to fix a mine cart. Let me see...

speaker: Seele
line: ...Hmm. Even the pin connecting the body to the chassis is broken, not to mention the rear wheelset bearing. This looks like the work of Svarog's minions.

speaker: Seele
line: Come on, we passed a lot of discarded mine carts on the way over, let's see if there are any components we can recycle.

speaker: Seele
line: We need to find spare parts we can use nearby. Argh, we're wasting time...

speaker: Findie
line: Beep, beep, beep... Friends, do you need to find something? Findie can help.

speaker: March 7th
line: ...How come you just jumped out on your own, little fella? Isn't your module thingy broken?

speaker: Findie
line: Beep, beep, beep... My brainwave scanner module is indeed broken. However, manual input for search is still operable.

speaker: Findie
line: Come on. Input the name of the object you are looking for. Findie can help.

speaker: March 7th
line: Oh, well aren't you confident? Let me give it a try then.

speaker: March 7th
line: Where's the input interface? Ah, found it...

speaker: March 7th
line: Mine Cart Pin... Mine Cart Wheelset... Confirm... Just like that?

speaker: Findie
line: Beep, beep, beep... Request is being processed...

speaker: Findie
line: Beep, beep, beep... Match successful... Initiating search for lost item: Mine Cart Pin...

speaker: Findie
line: Beep, beep, beep! Item found. Please commence search according to the Home-Use Object Finder Safety Manual.

text: Search for mine cart parts with the help of the Home-Use Object Finder

title: Step Description
content: The crisis in the mines is no more, and most of the Wildfire members have left the spot, escorting miners to safety along with them.However, Seele has not yet brought her captive, Bronya, to the chief, and you haven't had the chance to meet this important figure, a meeting with whom is the biggest motive behind this journey.And yet, the way forward is cut off by a mine cart out of order.Luckily, you happen to have picked up a Findie, a product from the Interastral Peace Corporation with the purpose of searching for things. Someone must have left behind in the mines. Maybe it can lead you to the parts required to fix the mine cart...

html_content:
(Interactive tutorial)
Activate Home-Use Object Finder to reveal the direction of the hidden item

text: ▶ Beep, beep, beep... As stated in the Terms of Service, my search result accuracy and reliability are not guaranteed. For more information, please call Interastral Peace Appliances.
▶ Beep, beep, beep... Based on your search history, I recommend the Humanoid Tactical Microwave. Press Skip to cancel personalized ads.
▶ Beep, beep, beep... Findie will create a calendar reminder for when you want to visit an Interastral Peace Appliances store.
▶ Beep, beep, beep... Interastral Peace Appliances, your most trustworthy companion.
▶ Beep, beep, beep! Potential target object detected. The current search has concluded, entering sleep mode...

speaker: Seele
line: Let me see... Yeah, we can make do with this part. This little machine isn't half bad.

speaker: Findie
line: Beep, beep, beep... What's that? Is that a hint of respect for Findie?

speaker: March 7th
line: How convenient! So next time Dan Heng gets lost, we can just use Findie to find him, right?

speaker: Findie
line: Beep, beep, beep... Biological life form search is currently not supported. If you have any questions, please call Interastral Peace Appliances.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: ...Well, it was a good idea. Let's look for the next part.

speaker: Findie
line: Beep, beep, beep... Initiating search for lost item: Mine Cart Wheelset...

speaker: Findie
line: Beep, beep, beep! Item found. Please commence search according to the Home-Use Object Finder Safety Manual.

text: ▶ Beep, beep, beep! Potential target object detected. The current search has concluded, entering sleep mode...

speaker: March 7th
line: That's everything!

speaker: March 7th
line: You were a big help, Findie!

speaker: Findie
line: Beep, beep, beep... It was nothing. Interastral Peace Appliances, your most trustworthy companion.

speaker: Findie
line: Beep, beep, beep... Current search complete. *yawn* Entering sleep mode. Please recharge the Home-Use Object Finder.

speaker: March 7th
line: ...We're pretty lucky, huh? Without Findie, it probably would've taken half the day to find these parts.

speaker: Seele
line: Well, not that long... But that little machine definitely made it a lot easier. Alright, let's go back and fix the mine cart.

text: (After finding all the mine cart parts)

speaker: March 7th
line: Are you gonna do it yourself?

speaker: Seele
line: Why wouldn't I? You've gotta be self-reliant down here. Watch, you might learn something.

text: Repair the out of order mine cart

title: Step Description
content: The way forward is cut off by a mine cart out of order. With Seele's instructions, you decide to search for backup parts in the area to repair the mine cart and move it out of the way."It's gonna be hectic trying to look for the parts." You can't help but pictureMr. Yangdestroying the cart with his black hole.

text: You all fix the mine cart together...

speaker: March 7th
line: Alright, mission accomplished!

speaker: Seele
line: Hmph, quick work. Y'know, I didn't think you guys had worked a day in your lives, but you know how to get your hands dirty.

speaker: March 7th
line: The cart is about to depart!

text: Continue deeper into the mines and find Oleg

title: Step Description
content: You fix the out of order mine cart and move it out of the way, opening the path continuing downward.This is near the bottom of the mines and you notice Seele's cautious expression and sharp gaze...Her expression is normally scary enough already, so what is it that would make her show an even more serious look? You're not sure, but there is one thing that you are certain of...Danger is closing in and you should make yourself prepared.

speaker: Seele
line: The robots will have seized the road ahead by now. We should go carefully.

speaker: March 7th
line: Whoa! Stop! Ah! Stop, stop, stop! There's a big evil hunk of metal right there!

speaker: Seele
line: That model... it's one of Svarog's lapdogs alright.

speaker: Seele
line: Don't be afraid, I've dealt with those robots before. Let's go!

text: (While passing the ledge overlooking the ore vein)

speaker: Bronya
line: Seeing it up close... this vein's even more spectacular.

speaker: Seele
line: I doubt the underground will ever see it fully excavated...

speaker: Clara
line: This vein... So this is what everyone is fighting over...

speaker: Clara
line: Mr. Svarog, it's such a massive vein. I've never seen so much Geomarrow before...

speaker: Svarog
line: Calculating... Based on the average rate of excavation, this vein is enough to supply Belobog with 231 days of energy, with a margin of error of 7 days.

speaker: Svarog
line: I sense that your reason for summoning me is not the ore in question. State your true intention, Clara.

speaker: Clara
line: ...Right. I wanted Mr. Svarog to see that many miners and vagrants have gotten hurt because of the vein... Can you help them?

speaker: Svarog
line: I have already prevented the dispute and taken temporary control of the excavation zone. Evaluation result: In the event of no further variables, there will be no large-scale armed conflict within the next 30 days.

speaker: Clara
line: I know why you did it, Mr. Svarog! It's just... I don't think it'll be enough.

speaker: Clara
line: The mining team and Wildfire... they don't understand your actions... If only we could do more for them...

speaker: Svarog
line: My mission is the protection of the Underworld. The trust of the minority sample is redundant to my calculations.

speaker: Svarog
line: Human behavior will always deviate from rational calculation, Clara...

speaker: Svarog
line: As evidenced by their presence here.

speaker: Seele
line: Svarog! We haven't settled our final score.

speaker: Svarog
line: Seele, subordinate to Wildfire... Your resistance is futile. The result of my calculation is unequivocal: Remaining in the Underworld is the optimal strategy for survival.

speaker: Seele
line: *sigh* This again... Calculation results, survival strategies... I haven't got time for your thesis. Withdraw your forces, or I'll lose my temper!

speaker: Svarog
line: Observe, Clara. Even under abject conditions, humans are unable to avoid division and conflict.

speaker: Clara
line: But, Mr. Svarog...

speaker: Svarog
line: Human failure to accept the calculation result is a significant threat to the survival strategy of the Underworld. Calculation complete, result unequivocal: Armed suppression of Wildfire and their allies is the optimal course of action.

text: This guy looks stronger than the other robots...

children.speaker: March 7th
children.line: And more fashionably dressed, too... Hey, is he about to leave? What about the girl in red?

text: His robots don't seem too friendly...

children.speaker: March 7th
children.line: Ah! What about the girl in red? That robot is gonna take her away!

speaker: Svarog
line: We must leave, Clara. External variables have triggered a calculation reset. The Furnace Core hub requires protection.

speaker: Clara
line: ...Please, Mills, don't hit them too hard.

speaker: Seele
line: *sigh* I was getting bored of those minions — time for a real fight. Come at me!

speaker: March 7th
line: Whew... not bad. How many of these big guys is Svarog hiding?

speaker: Seele
line: A lot... which is why Wildfire has never been able to take him down. Svarog's forces are too strong. We don't have enough firepower.

children.speaker: Seele
children.line: Clara? Don't worry about her. That girl is best pals with Svarog — she's always following behind him. He wouldn't harm her.

children.speaker: Seele
children.line: Like I told you. That guy barely leaves his nest — it's rare to see him away from the Furnace Core. Even when he does appear, he doesn't stick around for long. He leaves everything to his subordinates.

children.speaker: Seele
children.line: It might also have been because Clara was here — the little girl in red. She's best pals with Svarog — always following behind him.

speaker: Seele
line: I guess I'm just used to seeing them together now, even if I don't understand it. *sigh* Let's look for the chief.

speaker: Oleg
line: No need to look far.

speaker: Oleg
line: Nice work, Seele. We were attacked on both sides by robots — who knows where they came from. We thought we were in it for the long haul, hahaha!

speaker: Seele
line: Chief! Is everyone okay? Is anyone injured?

speaker: Oleg
line: We're fine — we're used to it at this point. We sent those pesky robots and ragtag troops packing. The mine should be quiet for a while.

speaker: Oleg
line: And who are your friends here...

speaker: Seele
line: Ahh, them! They're outsiders that Sampo brought down from who-knows-where. They need a favor from Wildfire, so I brought them with me. It'll be faster if they explain.

text: Are you the chief? You're a hard man to find.

children.speaker: Oleg
children.line: Hahaha! That's quite the tone to take on our first meeting. I won't forget you in a hurry.

text: Pleased to meet you. We're here to make friends with Wildfire.

children.speaker: Oleg
children.line: Hah, it's been a while since I heard that anyone was pleased to meet anyone, haha. I won't forget you in a hurry. Wildfire welcomes you.

speaker: Oleg
line: So, you went to all this trouble to find Wildfire. What help is it you need?

text: Telling Oleg and Seele about what happened and your mission to look for the Stellaron...

speaker: Seele
line: Ha! I didn't know you'd put on a show for the Overworld too. Impressive.

speaker: Oleg
line: Ho-ho, well this is new. Wildfire can barely take care of the Underworld, and now outsiders are looking for assistance from us.

speaker: Oleg
line: This "Stellaron" you speak of — I've never heard of it. But if it's a secret that even we locals don't know about, then one name does come to mind...

children.speaker: March 7th
children.line: Really? Sampo? You might as well try the supreme guardian .

speaker: Oleg
line: The current supreme guardian is a liar who uses sweet words to deceive the Underworld. She's never cared about our survival—

speaker: Bronya
line: Stop right there... I... won't allow you to insult the madam guardian.

speaker: Oleg
line: Miss Overworld, my words may be painful to you, but every one of them is true. Go out into the towns and hear for yourself — see how the people here suffer.

speaker: Oleg
line: I haven't gotten close to voicing the extent of the Underworld's grievances, young lady. But I will respect your request. I will leave it at that, for now.

speaker: Oleg
line: Let's get back to the main topic. The name that came to my mind, was Svarog.

speaker: March 7th
line: Huh...!? Isn't Svarog Wildfire's sworn enemy?

speaker: Dan Heng
line: Why would a mere robot in the Underworld have knowledge of important secrets?

speaker: Oleg
line: Sworn enemy? Not how I see it. The young master here is closer. Svarog is a cold and unfeeling machine. He recognizes only the dead reasoning of his calculations.

speaker: Oleg
line: Svarog is not against Wildfire... or perhaps I should say: Wildfire isn't even of concern to him. That ancient robot witnessed the war...

speaker: Oleg
line: If you're looking to pick up a thread... he may well be your best source.

text: Is he really that old? He looks pretty new.

children.speaker: March 7th
children.line: Don't judge a book by its cover. I myself have put a few centuries behind me. Would you be able to tell?

children.speaker: Dan Heng
children.line: I'm familiar with over twenty long-life species — none of them look like you.

children.speaker: March 7th
children.line: Hey! Would it kill you to play along?

text: You mean the war with the Antimatter Legion ?

children.speaker: March 7th
children.line: Yeah, I remember hearing this world was invaded by the Legion hundreds of years ago.

speaker: Oleg
line: Robots don't forget. If Svarog hasn't heard of your Stellaron, then I'm afraid perhaps no one has.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: In which case, we need to think of a way to convince Svarog to communicate with us.

speaker: March 7th
line: Or get him to hand over his memory bank. We could go through it ourselves.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: What should we do...

speaker: Oleg
line: We've tried repeatedly to negotiate with Svarog, but he rejects every effort. He believes that Wildfire is a threat. Still, if it were you guys...

speaker: Oleg
line: Hmm... It's difficult to say.

speaker: Oleg
line: ...We have time. Let's get into the detail tomorrow. It's late, and you must've been through a lot. Go back to the town and rest. I'll make arrangements.

speaker: March 7th
line: Again? I'm starting to get nervous of "arranged rest" on this planet...

speaker: Oleg
line: As for our Silvermane girl here... do you have time? I'd like to talk with you in private.

speaker: Bronya
line: Wildfire, the vagrants, Svarog... The changes in here are greater than I ever imagined. *sigh* What exactly did the Underworld go through after the Silvermane Guards left?

speaker: Bronya
line: ...Sorry, did you have something you wanted to say to me?

text: What do you think Oleg wants to talk about?

children.speaker: Bronya
children.line: I think I know what it will concern. Even if Oleg wasn't looking for me, I would've looked for him.

children.speaker: Bronya
children.line: I'm certain that the residents of the underground will have a lot they need to vent about. And as a Silvermane Guard, I have a lot that I need to ascertain. Nothing more.

text: What do you think of this Boss Svarog?

children.speaker: Bronya
children.line: According to Oleg, he's a robot that took part in the War of Defense over seven hundred years ago. He possesses a near-human intelligence, and rules over all the machinery in the underground...

children.speaker: Bronya
children.line: During the war , the Architects created astonishing mechanical soldiers, but the fight was so terrible that most were damaged or destroyed. The technology was lost.

children.speaker: Bronya
children.line: ...If what Oleg says is true, then Svarog is an Architect creation leftover from the Old Era.

text: You and Seele work well together.

children.speaker: Bronya
children.line: We do? I hadn't realized. I've received rigorous military training — coordinating with soldiers under any circumstances is easy for me...

children.text: You can say what you mean.
So it's really only the training?

children.speaker: Bronya
children.line: I admit, Seele is talented. We... do work well together. But that's all there is to it.

text: That's all I have to ask.

children.speaker: Bronya
children.line: Hey... Thanks for your concern. You should head back to the town, and... I'll do the same when Oleg and I are finished.

speaker: Oleg
line: ▶ Ah, young ( man / lady ) . This isn't the best place for a chat. Let's keep things brief.

children.speaker: Oleg
children.line: Svarog? He's an artificially intelligent being from the Old World. He was here when the underground was first constructed. That's about all I know.

children.speaker: Oleg
children.line: Now he guards the Furnace Core hub. Many vagrants have established bases in the vicinity, seeking Svarog's protection.

children.speaker: Oleg
children.line: You got the gist from Natasha, right? The miners and vagrants came to blows over the vein, then Svarog's subordinates pushed everyone back.

children.speaker: Oleg
children.line: Well, perhaps their methods were lacking in finesse, but that's essentially what they did.

children.text: So Svarog wasn't after the vein?

children.speaker: Oleg
children.line: You saw for yourself — after he pushed everyone back, he disappeared. It was clear: He didn't have any interest in the vein itself.

children.speaker: Oleg
children.line: If you want my take, he prevented another Underworld conflict, even if the execution was rough around the edges.

children.speaker: Oleg
children.line: His behavior says something about his thinking: "As long as everyone's been driven out, the conflict is over."

text: What do you want to say to Bronya?

children.speaker: Oleg
children.line: Well, I heard that she's a Silvermane Guard that was sent to arrest you. I expected you to be less friendly around each other... Are you worried about her?

children.speaker: Oleg
children.line: Oh, working together? Understood. Rest easy, I won't make things difficult for her.

children.speaker: Oleg
children.line: Hahahaha, you needn't worry! That Silvermane girl wouldn't be afraid of an old veteran anyway.

children.speaker: Oleg
children.line: Really? I'm surprised. Still, you can rest easy, I won't make things difficult for her.

children.speaker: Oleg
children.line: We haven't seen a Silvermane Guard down here for a long time now. I just wanna ask her a few questions, nothing more.

children.speaker: Oleg
children.line: It's getting late. You should go back to the town and get some rest.

speaker: Seele
line: You guys have some moves. If you need my help with anything, just shout.

children.speaker: Seele
children.line: Hmph, it'll take more than that. But you're not as bad as I took you for. You walk the talk.

children.speaker: Seele
children.line: Huh, couldn't even give it a minute, could you?

children.speaker: Seele
children.line: I've been on my feet all day. I don't have the energy for more headaches right now. Let me catch my breath and I'll come find you tomorrow.

speaker: Seele
line: Oh, I wanted to ask you — that Bronya girl... Is she really a Silvermane Guard?

children.speaker: Seele
children.line: Oh? She heads up the force? Hm... Not bad.

text: You don't think she's got the talent?

children.speaker: Seele
children.line: No, no, she's got skill alright, I can tell she's got training.

speaker: Seele
line: It's just... I thought that Silvermane Guards were all cold and unfeeling — they left the Underworld to perish. But she... doesn't give me that impression.

speaker: Seele
line: Anyway, I've got stuff to report to the chief. See you around.
